headlines.description: — Tottenham became the final team to lose its perfect record in the Premier League, falling 3-0 at Crystal Palace after new signing Odsonne Edouard scored twice to add to a penalty by Wilfried Zaha on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Tottenham loses perfect record in EPL in 3-0 loss at Palace

headlines.description: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang fired Arsenal to their first win of the season against Norwich on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Aubameyang secures Arsenal's first PL win

headlines.description: Leandro Trossard scored a late winner as Brighton & Hove Albion secured a 1-0 victory over wasteful Brentford.
headlines.shortLinkText: Late Trossard winner for Brighton hurts Brentford

headlines.description: Bernardo Silva scored the only goal of the game as champions Manchester City claimed all three points at Leicester City.
headlines.shortLinkText: Silva scores as Man City claim win at Leicester

headlines.description: Cristiano Ronaldo scored twice as Manchester United beat Newcastle United 4-1 at Old Trafford on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Ronaldo scores two on Man United return

headlines.description: Southampton were held to a 0-0 draw by 10-man West Ham after the Londoners had striker Michail Antonio sent off in second-half stoppage time.
headlines.shortLinkText: Antonio sees red as West Ham held at Southampton

headlines.description: Wolves claimed their first three points of the Premier League season on Saturday with a 2-0 victory over Watford.
headlines.shortLinkText: Wolves claim first league win of season at Watford

headlines.description: Romelu Lukaku and Mateo Kovacic scored for Chelsea as they beat Aston Villa 3-0 and kept the pressure on Manchester United.
headlines.shortLinkText: Lukaku scores brace as Chelsea beat Aston Villa
